title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project template built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and styled with Material UI (MUI). It serves as a foundational starting point for new applications, showcasing best practices with React Query for data fetching and providing a solid architectural base for scalable development leveraging modern web technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-Dashboard is a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to visualize and interact with the Robofleet robotics fleet management system. This project focuses on providing a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, managing tasks, and accessing relevant data, facilitating efficient operation and control of robotic deployments.

title: crud-expense-tracker
description: This CRUD Expense Tracker, built with JavaScript, CSS, and HTML alongside Material-UI, provides a simple and intuitive interface for managing and tracking personal expenses. Users can easily create, read, update, and delete expense entries, making it a practical project for learning front-end development and implementing fundamental CRUD operations.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [Insert the core purpose of the project based on the README - e.g., "creating a modern note-taking application" or "building a real-time collaborative coding environment"]. This repository showcases a [Mention key functionalities/features - e.g., "clean, modular architecture" or "user-friendly interface"] and leverages [Mention specific libraries or technologies used if prominent and important - e.g., "React" or "WebSocket for real-time communication"].

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository serves as a practical example and template for building data-rich web applications, demonstrating best practices for component structure, styling, and client-side data fetching within the Next.js framework. It's a helpful resource for developers looking to learn and implement dashboard solutions.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using LaTeX for professional formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for web-based display. It serves as a project demonstrating proficiency in document creation and presentation, showcasing skills and experience in a clean and structured manner.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-Idea-Board is a web application built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and visualize project ideas. This project provides a dynamic and interactive board for capturing thoughts, connecting concepts, and developing potential initiatives, making it a valuable tool for project planning and collaborative idea generation.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS designed to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to input their sleep schedule and track the cumulative difference between their target sleep hours and actual sleep, providing insights into their overall sleep health. As a Typescript project, it showcases best practices for structuring and maintaining a modern web application.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a streamlined and secure platform for creating and participating in polls and voting events. This project showcases best practices in front-end development, focusing on user experience, responsive design, and leveraging the power of Next.js for server-side rendering and API routes to manage voting data.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains various projects focused on applying Python to finance. It explores key financial concepts through practical examples and aims to provide a hands-on learning experience for those interested in leveraging Python for financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization. Explore different financial projects within this repository.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project demonstrates the implementation of Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations, offering a practical example of developing a web application using the Flask framework and a PostgreSQL database. It serves as a learning resource and reference project for those interested in Python web development.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project leveraging HTML and Python to create interactive and dynamic map visualizations. This repository explores techniques for displaying geographical data and insights on a map interface, suitable for projects involving location-based information and spatial analysis. It aims to provide a practical demonstration of integrating web technologies with data visualization methods.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express, leveraging the Gemini API to provide an interactive and engaging conversational AI experience. This project demonstrates a modern full-stack development approach, incorporating technologies like CSS, JavaScript, and HTML for a dynamic user interface and a robust backend for handling API interactions and serving content. It showcases a practical implementation of AI-powered communication within a web-based platform.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase. The project allows users to monitor and manage the location of assets in real-time, leveraging serverless functions and a scalable database for efficient data handling. It demonstrates best practices for building performant and maintainable web applications using cutting-edge technologies.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project designed to create a flexible and interactive event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a functional calendar interface that can be dynamically populated with events, making it easily customizable for various scheduling and organizational purposes. This project offers a starting point for implementing event management features in web applications.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, designed to simplify the analysis and visualization of ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project facilitates efficient debugging and performance monitoring by providing a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and interpret ROS logs, making it an invaluable asset for robotics developers working on ROS-based projects.

title: atg-world
description: ATG-World is a dynamic web project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, designed to [insert the project's purpose - e.g., explore interactive 3D environments, showcase a portfolio, etc.].  This repository contains all the source code and assets necessary to run the application, focusing on [mention a key feature or aspect of the project - e.g., responsive design, interactive user experience, data visualization]. Explore the codebase to learn more about its implementation and contribute to its development!

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a modern e-commerce web application built using Next.js 14 with the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching. The project leverages Material UI (MUI) for a clean and responsive user interface, offering a type-safe environment for building a scalable and performant online fruit marketplace. It demonstrates best practices in Next.js development and provides a foundation for learning and contributing to e-commerce web applications.
